title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
Join us as a Sales Development Representative (SDR) and fuel our growth!
   

  

 Are you a dynamic and results-driven professional with a knack for driving sales opportunities? Velory, an innovative IT Lifecycle Management Platform, is on the lookout for a talented Sales Development Representative (SDR) to play a key role in our expansion across the Nordics and beyond. As an SDR at Velory, you will be at the forefront of generating leads and opportunities for our Account Executives.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Conduct proactive outreach and prospecting activities to identify and qualify potential leads.
* Collaborate closely with marketing and sales teams to align strategies and target key accounts.
* Utilize various communication channels, including phone, email, and social media, to engage with potential customers.
* Develop a deep understanding of Velory's value proposition and effectively communicate it to prospects.
* Nurture leads through strategic follow-ups and maintain accurate records in the CRM system.
* Collaborate with Account Executives to ensure a seamless handover of qualified leads.
* Stay informed about industry trends and competitor activities to enhance the effectiveness of outreach strategies.
* Meet and exceed targets for lead generation and qualification.


**Who You Are**
 At Velory, we value individuals who embody our core values:
   

  

* Show ownership: Take the initiative and contribute to the bigger picture.
* Manage speed: Eliminate obstacles to maintain a high, sustainable pace.
* Represent quality: Aim high, pay attention to details, and iterate.
* Earn trust: Be communicative, transparent, and follow through on commitments.
* Deliver wow: Go above and beyond expectations in a creative and unexpected way.


**Requirements**
* 1-3 years of experience in a similar role in SaaS.
* Proven track record of successfully generating and qualifying B2B leads.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Familiarity with CRM tools and sales technologies.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a dynamic team.
* Results-oriented mindset with a focus on achieving and exceeding targets.


**Nice to Have**
* Experience working towards IT organizations.
* Familiarity with IT Lifecycle Management concepts.


**What We Offer**
* Competitive base salary and performance-based incentives.
* A dynamic and inclusive team in a fast-growing startup environment.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement.
* Freedom and flexibility in work arrangements.
* Centrally located office in Stockholm.
* Six weeks of paid vacation.
* Pension at ITP1 levels.
* Generous wellness grant and weekly training sessions.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Breakfast buffet in the office every day.
* Use our own Velory Portal to select the hardware you want for work.


**How To Apply**
 If you are passionate about driving sales success, enthusiastic about technology, and eager to contribute to the growth of a dynamic startup, we would love to hear from you! Send your resume and a cover letter to apply now.
   

  

 Velory AB is an equal opportunity employer, promoting diversity and inclusion in our workplace. We look forward to welcoming driven individuals who share our vision and values.
   

  

**This is Velory**
 Velory is a lifecycle management platform with an unmatched experience for handling IT in an automated, secure and circular way.
   

  

* Procurement - empower your employees with the right hardware and software through an individually customized store.
* IT asset management (ITAM) - automate asset management across the employee and device lifecycle
* Zero touch IT - automate your IT related workflows by accessing an ecosystem of related solutions in one interface


 Velory is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Identity Security Consultant
description:
**Company Description** 




 Nordic Cyber Group (NCG) is a fast-growing cybersecurity consulting firm specializing in Identity Security, Digital Compliance, and Digital Fraud and Financial Crime - located in Stockholm, Sweden. NCG is dedicated to helping organizations worldwide build confidence in navigating complex cybersecurity challenges. With a global client base, NCG is now looking for a Identity Security Consultant to join the team!
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As an Identity Security Consultant, you'll play a key role in designing, implementing, and optimizing IGA and PAM solutions, helping organizations mitigate identity-related risks while enabling seamless and secure access for employees, partners, and customers. In this role, you will,
 



  




* Support organizations in assessing, designing, and implementing Identity Security solutions based on customer specifications and requirements. This includes lifecycle management, access management (SSO, SAML, OIDC), identity governance, and privilege access management, etc.
* Implement IAM solutions and integrate them with existing systems and platforms. This may include configuring software products, developing custom solutions, and integrating with other security technologies.
* Conduct security assessments to identify potential risks and vulnerabilities in the IAM system and work to develop measures to address them. This includes monitoring system activity, investigating incidents, and implementing security improvements.
* Gather business, functional, and non-functional requirements (including all major compliance standards) to design security risk-free architectures as part of existing security posture improvements or migration projects.
* Provide training and support to users and administrators to ensure proper use of the IAM system and to address any questions or issues that arise.
* Collaborate with others (C-management, engineering, infrastructure, development, database, security operations) to develop corporate security standards (including all major Clouds)



  





**We are looking for someone who has** 



* Worked 4-10 years in a similar role and has very good experience in IGA or PAM
* Certified professional and specialist in at least 1 of the following products: SailPoint IIQ, Saviynt, Okta, Autho, CyberArk
* Very good knowledge of Active Directory and SSO (single sign on)
* Successfully executed at least one Cloud security project
* Experience in development and scripting skills in, for example, Powershell
* Understanding and interest in regulations and experience of working in regulated activities
* Good teamwork skills and willingness to work both in a team and independently.



  





**Why Join NCG?** 



* Competitive Remuneration: We offer an excellent salary package along with a generous bonus structure, including rewards for client acquisition, individual performance, and overall company success.
* Health and Wellbeing: Your wellbeing matters to us. You'll receive an annual wellness allowance to spend on activities that help you stay healthy — such as gym memberships, yoga, or sports. In addition, you'll get a lunch benefit through ePassi, making it easy to enjoy nutritious meals during your workday.
* Work Flexibility: Work from anywhere in Europe! We trust you to deliver great results, wherever you are, as long as it aligns with client needs.
* Learning and Development: We're committed to helping you grow. You'll have access to free training and certifications throughout the year - including exam and maintenance fees — so you can stay ahead in your field.



  





  





 #Hiring #WeAreHiring #IdentitySecurity #IAM #IGA #PAM #CyberSecurityJobs #AccessManagement #IdentityGovernance #CloudSecurity #SecurityConsulting #TechJobs #Infosec

title: Major Sales Director, Nordics
description:
**Welcome to the future of cloud networking and security!**
 Cato Networks is the first company to converge enterprise networking and security into one centralized and global service that is delivered by cloud. It is led by networking and security pioneer Shlomo Kramer (Check Point, Imperva) and early investor (Palo Alto Networks, Exabeem, Trusteer and more). Cato’s unique technology inspired a brand-new product category, later named “SASE” by Gartner and a market expected to reach $28.5 billion by 2028.
   

  

 This is your opportunity to get on the rocket ship and join a company that is building a cutting-edge enterprise network and secure cloud platform, and is on a fast track to becoming the worldwide market leader – don’t miss it!
   

  

 We’re looking for a Major Sales Director who shares this passion for cybersecurity and SaaS innovation. If you’re ready to take on the challenge of selling cutting-edge solutions to large enterprise organisations, we’d love to have you on our team.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead the Sales Process: Own and drive the sales cycle from prospecting to closing, securing high-value deals with large enterprise accounts. You’ll build long-lasting partnerships that deliver real value to our clients.
* Engage with Senior Decision-Makers: Connect with C-level leaders (CIOs, CISOs, CTOs), understanding their needs and aligning our solutions with their business objectives.
* Manage Complex Sales Cycles: Navigate lengthy sales cycles (9+ months), managing multiple stakeholders while maintaining momentum, resilience, and focus.
* Collaborate & Mentor: Work alongside a talented sales team, sharing your knowledge, best practices, and insights to support collective growth and achievement.
* Partner for Growth: Collaborate with MSSPs, VARs, and other key partners to expand market reach, bringing our solutions to even more organisations.
* Customer Acquisition & Expansion: Develop and execute strategic sales plans to acquire new enterprise customers and expand within existing accounts.
* Consultative Selling: Apply value-led, consultative sales techniques to identify and advance opportunities that drive ongoing profitable revenue growth.
* C-Level Engagement: Establish and maintain strong executive relationships within client organisations, positioning the company as a long-term strategic partner.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience: 7+ years of experience in enterprise cybersecurity, or related industry, with proven success in managing complex sales cycles and engaging with C-level decision-makers.
* Proven Success: A demonstrated history of consistently exceeding $1M+ ARR quotas and driving substantial revenue growth.
* Industry Knowledge: Deep understanding of cybersecurity, SaaS, or networking solutions, with awareness of current market trends and competitive positioning.
* Relationship-Driven: You excel at building long-term, trust-based relationships with key stakeholders and decision-makers.
* Collaborative: Experience working with partners, MSSPs, VARs, and other strategic collaborators to drive sales and expand business opportunities.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Vi står inför en spännande fas där vi
 **tar vår plattform in i molnet (AWS)** 
 och nu söker vi en
 **AWS Cloud Engineer** 
 som vill vara med och bygga en stabil, säker och skalbar driftsmiljö.
   

  

 Det här är en nyckelroll där du får kombinera teknik, struktur och utvecklarstöd och vara med och forma hur vi bygger framtidens infrastruktur på Kleer.
   

  

 Kleer är ekonomi- och lönehantering för moderna SaaS- och konsultbolag. Vi kombinerar Sveriges mest automatiserade ekonomisystem med ett dedikerat ekonomiteam. Resultatet: finansiell kontroll i realtid, minimal administration och en ekonomi som driver affären – inte bara rapporterar om den.
   

  

 Vi har utsetts till DI Gasell sju gånger och är stolta över vår värderingsstyrda kultur som bygger på ansvar, glädje, nyfikenhet och prestigelöshet. Idag är vi cirka 200 medarbetare med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Vara med och bygga upp och vidareutveckla vår AWS-miljö med fokus på stabilitet, säkerhet och skalbarhet
* Säkerställa bra grundförutsättningar för driftsättning och stabil drift i AWS
* Arbeta med Kubernetes som en central del i vår plattform
* Driva automationsarbete och standardisering med Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Stötta utvecklingsteamen i moln-relaterade frågor kring deployment, access, nätverk och drift
* Förbättra observabilitet: loggning, monitorering, larm och incidentberedskap
* Bidra till kunskapsdelning, dokumentation och arbetssätt som gör oss snabbare och tryggare


**Vem är du?**
**Vi Tror Att Du Har**
* God förståelse för AWS och hur man bygger stabila molnmiljöer över tid
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes i drift och förvaltning
* Praktisk erfarenhet av IaC-verktyg som Terraform eller CloudFormation
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg (primärt GitLab)
* God förståelse för nätverk, containerisering (Docker) och orkestrering (Kubernetes)
* Kunskap om säkerhetsprinciper i molnet och erfarenhet av att implementera säkerhetskontroller
* Van att arbeta med övervakning och observabilitets-verktyg (t.ex. Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch)
* Förmåga att skapa struktur, standarder och hållbara lösningar
* Trivs med att jobba i team och kommunicera med olika delar av organisationen.


 Meriterande är erfarenhet av kostnadsstyrning i molnet och tidigare deltagande i större migreringsprojekt. Det är en fördel om man jobbat i en Java-värld tidigare men det går bra att även ha jobbat i andra miljöer.
   

  

 🚀AI som en naturlig del av vardagen
   

  

 På Kleer tror vi att framtidens team använder AI för att bli både snabbare och bättre.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du gillar att använda AI i ditt arbete – exempelvis för att:
   

  

* felsöka och analysera incidenter snabbare
* skapa bättre dokumentation och effektivare onboarding
* automatisera repetitiva moment och förbättra driftbarhet
* få stöd i designval och tekniska resonemang


 Du behöver inte vara “AI-expert”, men du är nyfiken och ser värdet av att jobba AI-stöttat.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En viktig roll i ett snabbväxande bolag med stark kultur och höga ambitioner
* Ett tight teknikteam med hög samarbetsgrad och fokus på lärande
* Flexibla arbetstider, möjlighet till hybridarbete och balans mellan arbete & fritid
* Förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, föräldralön och kompetensutveckling
* Ett modernt kontor i centrala Stockholm med gym, frukt och sociala aktiviteter


 📍
 **Ort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

 📅
 **Start:** 
 Omgående, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid
   

  

 ⏳
 **Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 👉 Urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Kleer är ekonomi- och lönehantering för moderna SaaS- och konsultbolag. Vi kombinerar Sveriges mest automatiserade ekonomisystem med ett dedikerat ekonomiteam. Resultatet: finansiell kontroll i realtid, minimal administration och en ekonomi som driver affären – inte bara rapporterar om den.
   

  

 Vi har utsetts till DI Gasell sju gånger och är stolta över vår värderingsstyrda kultur som bygger på ansvar, glädje, nyfikenhet och prestigelöshet. Idag är vi cirka 200 medarbetare med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.

title: Operational Test lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* You have experience of test management in IT projects.
* You have good understanding of testing methodology (e.g. ISTQB).
* You have practical experience of testing, manual and understands test automation.
* You have the ability to analyze requirements and translate them into test cases.
* You have experience of testing tools such as Jira, XRay, Postman or similar.
* You have good communication and collaboration skills.
* You have the ability to work in a structured and independent manner.
* You are fluent in Swedish and English (speaking and writing)


**Application deadline:** 
 03-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Solution Architect - (Java, RedHat, Angular, Cloud)
description:
**Solution Architect - Java, Databases, RedHat, Angular, REST APIs, SOAP WebServices, and Microservices, Azure or AWS cloud, Scrum, SAFe** 




  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Hybrid / Remote options available
 



**Contract Type:** 
 6–12 Month Contract]
 



**Seniority Level:** 
 Senior / 8+ Years Experience
 



  





 We are seeking a highly skilled Solution Architect with a strong background in Java, cloud technologies, and AI. The ideal candidate has extensive experience providing detailed solution designs across business, application, data, process, and technology architecture viewpoints. You will play a critical role in shaping enterprise-wide IT solutions, guiding teams on technical decisions, and ensuring high-quality architectural standards.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and deliver comprehensive solution designs, including High-Level Designs (HLD) and architectural artefacts.
* Provide architectural inputs covering business, application, data, process, and technology perspectives.
* Evaluate multiple alternatives, outlining benefits and drawbacks for informed decision-making.
* Design and implement integration patterns using REST APIs, SOAP WebServices, and Microservices.
* Work with Java, Databases, RedHat, Angular, and cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS.
* Collaborate effectively within an agile environment (Scrum and SAFe) to deliver scalable solutions.
* Motivate teams to find simple solutions to complex problems and communicate these clearly.
* Coordinate IT activities across enterprise environments, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
* Share knowledge and mentor colleagues, fostering a culture of continuous learning.


- 


**Essential Skills & Experience:** 



* Minimum 5 years as a solution architect in enterprise environments.
* Strong experience with Java, Databases, RedHat, Angular, REST APIs, SOAP WebServices, and Microservices.
* Solid understanding of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS) and cloud AI solutions.
* Knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe).
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and the motivation to take on new responsibilities.
* Strong communication skills, fluent in English (Swedish language skills are a plus).
* Proven ability to work in large organizational settings and coordinate IT activities.

title: Cloud Engineer Intune till Heras Group Sweden AB!
description:
*Vill du ta ägarskap för en modern device management* 
*‑* 
*plattform med fokus på användarupplevelse, standardisering och säkerhet? Gillar du att kombinera hands* 
*‑* 
*on arbete med att utveckla och förbättra lösningar i en internationell organisation? Då kan detta vara rätt roll för dig.*
**Din Vardag**
 I rollen som Cloud Engineer Intune får du ett tydligt mandat att vidareutveckla och drifta en modern workplace- och MDM-plattform. Du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt med att designa, konfigurera och administrera Intune för flera enhetstyper (Windows, iOS, Android och macOS), inklusive compliance, konfigurationsprofiler och applikationsdeployment/paketering.
   

  

 Som Cloud Engineer Intune är du en nyckelperson i resan mot Modern Management (t.ex. Autopilot, BYOD och Zero Trust) och samarbetar nära säkerhetsfunktionerna, bland annat med Conditional Access i Entra IDVardagen är projektintensiv och varierad – det här är inte en ren förvaltningsroll. Du jobbar tillsammans med interna och externa parter, tar tekniskt ansvar, felsöker klient- och enhetsrelaterade problem och ser till att lösningar, policies och arbetssätt blir dokumenterade och hållbara över tid.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen som Cloud Engineer Intune tror vi att du har:
   

  

* Hands-on erfarenhet av Microsoft Intune i större och/eller distribuerade miljöer
* Mycket god kunskap i Microsoft 365 och Entra ID (Azure AD)
* Erfarenhet av att hantera Windows 10/11, iOS och Android-enheter
* God förståelse för säkerhetsprinciper som Zero Trust och Conditional Access
* Erfarenhet av Autopilot och modern device lifecycle management
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta tekniskt ägarskap
* Flytande svenska och god engelska i tal och skrift
* Meriterande: PowerShell och/eller Microsoft Security-lösningar (t.ex. Defender for Endpoint), samt vana av internationell organisation


 Som person är du en person som gillar att ta ansvar och vara synlig i organisationen. Du är nyfiken, driven och trivs när allt inte är helt “färdigbyggt” ännu – du bidrar med struktur även när miljön förändras snabbt. Samtidigt är du samarbetsinriktad och kommunikativ; du vågar ta dialoger, fatta beslut och skapa förtroende hos olika intressenter.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Heras med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Gustaf Linder på gustaf.linder@wise.se. Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande och även så urvalet av kandidater som går vidare till intervju. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Om oss**
 Heras Group is Europe’s leading provider of permanent and mobile perimeter protection solutions. With operations across multiple countries and a clear growth strategy, we combine industrial strength with a modern, digital way of working. IT and cloud services play a key

title: Data Engineer Insight
description:
**Data Engineer**
**Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?**
 Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.
   

  

**Do you want to be our next ”Data Ninja”?**
 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
* Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
* Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
* Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
* Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
* You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.


**Based on our criteria för the role, we expect you to have:**
* Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
* Minimum 2 years experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
* Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
* In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
* Experience in information and dimensional modelling
* Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
* Speaks English and Swedish fluently


**Meritorious** 
**experience:**
* Platform modernisation
* Tabular cubes and DAX
* Data Vault modelling
* Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure

title: Solutions Consultant
description:
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks®, we’re united by a shared mission—to protect our digital way of life. We thrive at the intersection of innovation and impact, solving real-world problems with cutting-edge technology and bold thinking. Here, everyone has a voice, and every idea counts. If you’re ready to do the most meaningful work of your career alongside people who are just as passionate as you are, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 In order to be the cybersecurity partner of choice, we must trailblaze the path and shape the future of our industry. This is something our employees work at each day and is defined by our values: Disruption, Collaboration, Execution, Integrity, and Inclusion. We weave AI into the fabric of everything we do and use it to augment the impact every individual can have. If you are passionate about solving real-world problems and ideating beside the best and the brightest, we invite you to join us!
   

  

 This role is remote, but distance is no barrier to impact. Our hybrid teams collaborate across geographies to solve big problems, stay close to our customers, and grow together. You will be part of a culture that values trust, accountability, and shared success where your work truly matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Team Our Solutions Consultant team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to transform their security architectures. You are empowered with unmatched systems and tools and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. Our Solutions Consulting community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life. Job Summary The Solutions Consultant is the evolution of the traditional Sales Engineering role, aligning how we best serve our customers in understanding their environment, providing solution guidance and ensuring value realization in their investment with Palo Alto Networks. As a Solutions Consultant you provide technical leadership and expertise and guidance in your customer’s security transformation journey. You will play a key role in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives and ensuring value realization of their investment with Palo Alto Networks. You evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security operations services that establish PANW as your customer’s cybersecurity partner of choice. Key Responsibilities Curiosity is core to the Solutions Consultant role, and you see complex problems as opportunities to learn and deliver innovative solutions! You define your impact by: Meeting and exceeding sales quotas by building and implementing strategic, technical account plans that target cross-platform solutions Understands Key customer business requirements and has the ability to position, demonstrate and create high level designs across the entire PANW portfolio solutions creating business value for customers Ability to drive customer adoption of Palo Alto Networks Platform. Building customer relationships by helping customers achieve increased productivity, operational efficiency, security efficacy, and greater flexibility to innovate Conducting discovery to understand and articulate the key technical, operational, and commercial imperatives of your prospects and customers Working closely with Professional Services, Customer Success and Specialist teams to ensure overall customer implementation and adoption of solutions Demonstrating strong communication skills, influencing through effective presentations and customer-specific demos, and conducts technical engagements and workshops that are clear and impactful, simplifying complex ideas for various audiences Leading successful technical validation efforts based on best practices to ensure technical win in assigned opportunities Demonstrates Cross functional leadership driving collaboration and orchestrating supporting resources (Specialists, Channel Resources, Customer Support) to ensure a one-team approach that demonstrates a cohesive strategy Promoting end-to-end solutions that include PANW and/or partner professional services to ensure customers realize business value sooner Understanding the competitive landscape and effectively differentiating PANW's leadership in the cybersecurity space Continuously investing in yourself to develop technical and professional skills that drive your ever-increasing contributions to success of our customers while actively participating within the Solutions Consultant community and at industry events Identifying technical stakeholders and cultivating relationships with key personas to build and drive a security architecture transformation roadmap
   

  

**Qualifications (Additional Job Description)**
 Required Qualifications 6+ years experience in pre-sales/sales engineering Skilled in at least one of the following Networking, Network Security, Cybersecurity, Private/Public Cloud Security, SOC/Endpoint or SASE Experience in delivering cybersecurity solutions that solve technical challenges and influence new business initiatives is preferred Influencing and gaining buy-in from key stakeholders, either in a customer-facing or internal role; prior experience in a pre-sales role is ideal Creating and delivering technical presentations, workshops, or technical validation engagements Experience in selling, designing, implementing, or managing one or more of the following solutions: Network Security, SASE, SaaS, CNAPP and/or SOC Transformation Technologies Partnering with Customer Support functions to ensure successful implementation and adoption of sold solutions Experience in complex sales involving long sales processes with multiple buying centers and multi-product solutions are preferred This is a field sales position where travel requirements may be required to support in person customer meetings, please discuss with the recruiter on the specifics for this position. Proficient in English and Swedish
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com .
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
   

  

 Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship? No. Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.

title: SAP S/4 Solution Architect
description:
**Project** 




 The S/4 Solution Architect is responsible for overall solution integrity, ensuring architectural consistency, quality, and sustainability across the S/4 landscape.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Own and govern the overall S/4 solution architecture
* Ensure design decisions align with SAP best practices and long-term enterprise architecture principles
* Review and approve key solution designs across streams
* Act as final architectural escalation point for complex design topics
* Ensure alignment between functional design, technical architecture, integration, and data strategy
* Support leadership with architectural risk assessments and mitigation strategies



  





**Key Skills & Experience** 



* 10+ years of SAP architecture experience
* Proven hands-on experience as S/4 Solution Architect
* Strong understanding of SAP Activate, clean core, extensibility concepts
* Experience in retail or large consumer-facing enterprises preferred



  





**Reporting & Interfaces** 



* Reports to: S/4 Transformation Lead
* Interfaces with: Integration Architect, Domain Architects, SI Architecture Leads

title: Founding Growth Operator - Jecta AI
description:
Jecta AI is building the next generation of Customer Success: an intelligent, AI-powered operating agent that helps subscription and tech companies grow through their customers. Jecta AI is a Startdeliver company, backed by a proven team with deep experience in Customer Success and B2B SaaS.
 



  





 We’re ambitious team with strong traction, a global customer base across 10+ markets, and we’re now entering an exciting scale-up phase.
 



  





 We’re looking for a founding growth operator to join us early and help shape how Jecta grows.
 



 This is a hands-on, commercial role. You’ll be close to customers and revenue from day one: running sales calls, demos, onboarding, and customer conversations. Not as support - but with a clear growth mindset. You’ll learn what drives adoption, expansion, and retention, and turn real customer insight into action.
 



  





 This role is designed for someone who wants to build now and grow into a C-level role over time.
 



  





 What you’ll do
 


* Run sales and demo calls and talk to customers weekly
* Own early customer journeys with commercial intent (activation, expansion, retention)
* Identify and act on growth opportunities from customer insight
* Run hands-on growth experiments across sales, product, and GTM
* Work closely with the CEO, Product, and Engineering in a fast-moving setup



  





 Who you are
 


* Smart, tech-savvy, and comfortable talking to customers
* Triggered by growth, revenue, and momentum
* Hands-on, curious, and biased toward execution
* You’ve had enough real-world experience to hold your own in commercial and customer conversations
* Early in your career but aiming high - future C-level or founder path



  





 Why Jecta AI
 


* Founding role with real ownership and influence
* Small team, big responsibility, zero politics
* Proven traction with customers across 10+ markets
* Competitive compensation, including potential stock options
* A steep learning curve at the intersection of AI, tech, and growth
* A role that can evolve into Head of Growth / CRO / CCO as we scale



  





*Ready to grow with us?* 




 Apply now, and be part of shaping the future of Customer Success.

title: PRODUCT OWNER BI & ANALYTICS NCAB GROUP
description:
*At NCAB Group we are on an exciting journey to become even more data-driven. We are recruiting a Product Owner for BI & Analytics to help us get there. In this global role, you’ll guide the development of scalable, cutting-edge BI, analytics and AI solutions that turn complex data into actionable insights. Working at the intersection of technology, data and business, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to our company’s future growth.*
 What You’ll Do as Product Owner for BI and Analytics?
   

  

 As our Product Owner for BI & Analytics, you will play a key role in shaping how we use data and turn it into meaningful insights and real impact. Working as part of our global IT team, you’ll bridge business needs with technical possibilities, ensuring that our BI & Analytics solutions deliver real value across the organization. NCAB is investing in a modern digital landscape, and we have a new data platform built on Microsoft cloud technology. In this role, you’ll also have the chance to explore how AI can help us make smarter and faster decisions and create even more value from our data. This is a highly collaborative role, where you’ll work closely with engaged data engineers, architects and business stakeholders.
   

  

 This role is based from our office in Sundbyberg (Stockholm). We offer a hybrid solution and some travel is required, to our different sites.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
**Product vision and strategy** 
 . Define and own the roadmap for BI & Analytics, aligning with our goals and stakeholder needs
   

  

**Stakeholder management** 
 . Engage with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into actionable user stories, manage expectations, communicate progress transparently
   

  

**Backlog management** 
 . Prioritize and manage the product backlog, balancing business value, technical feasibility, resource constraints
   

  

**Data and report development** 
 . Work together with the team to secure high quality end-to-end data solutions
   

  

**Data governance** 
 . Promote data governance, quality, and compliance across the IT landscape
   

  

**User engagement & adoption** 
 . Drive user adoption through training, documentation and continuous feedback including the rollout of self-service capabilities
   

  

 Are You the One We’re Looking For?
   

  

 We’re looking for you who have experience as a Product Owner, Product Manager, Business Analyst or a similar role within analytics. You probably also have a relevant academic degree. You have a good understanding within the data domain including data modeling and data engineering best practices. A familiarity with — or strong curiosity about generative AI will be an advantage as we explore new ways to leverage data and innovation.
   

  

 Your personality and commitment are key to succeeding in this role. You are curious, proactive and brave. Your great communication and collaboration skills are essential for influencing and interacting with colleagues and business stakeholders. You thrive in a team where we help and support each other and have a lot of freedom as well as high level of responsibility. You’re a natural and prestige less leader who thrives in cross-functional environments and knows how to inspire collaboration and drive change.
   

  

 Sounds Interesting?
   

  

 We are collaborating with Nexer Recruit regarding this recruitment. Please contact recruitment consultant Artan Bitiqi, artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com / 072-361 28 44 or Jenny Nilsson, jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com / 070-301 82 79, should you want to learn more about the position. We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 NCAB GROUP AS AN EMPLOYER
   

  

*NCAB Group is a leading global PCB supplier founded in 1993 in Sweden. Today, we have local presence in 19 countries in Europe, Asia and North America and customers in 45 countries worldwide. Revenue in 2024 amounted to 342,000,000 USD. Our mission is to produce PCBs for demanding customers, on time with zero defects, sustainably at the lowest total cost.*
*We offer our employees opportunities to develop in a fast-growing environment and provide an attractive salary package. At NCAB Group, our people make us unique. Our shared values are the foundation of an empowering working environment.*

title: Supporttekniker
description:
Har du arbetat något/några år i en servicedesk, som onsite-tekniker eller IT-tekniker ? Vi på Nexer Infrastructure i Stockholm söker nu fler konsulter som är sugna på att fördjupa sina kunskaper samt utvecklas inom IT. Hos oss får chansen att arbeta hos välkända bolag i Stockholmsområdet.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer
* En familjär atmosfär och teambuildingaktiviteter med dina Nexer-kollegor


**Om tjänsten**
 Som konsult inom IT-support arbetar du brett inom IT och användarstöd, och mer specifikt mot ramverk och verktyg så som Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365, grundläggande nätverksteknologier och ärendehanteringssystem såsom ServiceNow med flera. De flesta uppdragen innebär att du hjälper någon av våra kunder med IT-support på klientsidan och supporterar internt anställda genom telefon, mail, chatt och ärendehanteringssystem. I vissa uppdrag kan även onsite-support förekomma samt hårdvarusupport för datorer, kringutrustning, skrivare och AV utrustning.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du**
* Har minst ett års erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk/first line support
* Motiveras av att lösa problem och lämna användaren med ett leende på läpparna
* Trivs i att bemöta människor och ge stöttning på ett pedagogiskt sätt
* Har obehindrade kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift


 Vi ser gärna att du är bekant med följande tekniker: Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365/Azure, Windows Remote Desktop, SCCM/Intune, arbete i ärendehanteringssystem samt grundläggande kunskap inom felsökning av nätverk. Det är också ett plus om du har supporterat Mac klienter tidigare.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult hos oss tror vi att du har god analytisk förmåga, tar initiativ och är ihärdig när det gäller felsökning och problemlösning. Vi tror även att du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både individuellt och i grupp, eftersom du som konsult kan komma att arbeta i olika sammanhang.
   

  

**Mer om Nexer Infrastructure**
 Nexer Infrastructure (vi hette då Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och IT-infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och framtids säkra sin kompetens med hjälp av flexibla konsulttjänster. Bland våra kunder finns många välkända aktörer som är marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.
   

  

 Som IT- konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och vi är måna om att du ska trivas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att upprätthålla den goda stämningen i vår grupp, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och gemensamma lunch träffar. Blir du konsult hos oss lyssnar vi till dig, dina behov och i vilken riktning du vill utvecklas.
   

  

  

  

**Ansökan** 
  

  

 Då urval sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att läsa den!

title: Software Engineer Consultant
description:
**Let's build Pyyne together!** 




  





 Are you thrilled about being part of a team that believes a positive working culture is as important as impactful deliveries? If so, we can’t wait to connect with you!
 



  





 We're on the lookout for an enthusiastic team player who is ready to make a meaningful difference not only at Pyyne but also in the tech industry. Here, you’ll collaborate with a diverse group of talented individuals, developing innovative solutions for clients in sectors like Green Energy, MedTech, and more.
 



  





 At Pyyne, we don’t just develop software; we develop people. Our core values guide us each day: striving for excellence in everyone, sharing knowledge, collaborating, creating genuine impact, and fostering leadership at every level.
 



 Are you ready to embark on this exciting journey with us? Let’s connect!
 



  





**What impact can you have as a Software Engineer Consultant at Pyyne:** 




 At Pyyne, you will be part of a team that believes that developing disruptive solutions is as important as having fun while doing so. Here, we work with clients in multiple areas, from Green Energy, MedTech to Retail and Music Streaming.
 



  





 As consultants at Pyyne, we believe that making a true impact involves actively shaping a role you can be proud of. This means you won't just be part of a team; you'll also have a voice in how things are managed and run. Your impact goes beyond just the technical aspects; it also extends to business and society as a whole. No project is too big for us, if you can dream it, we can achieve it together.
 



  





 The
 **Consultant role** 
 at Pyyne is inherently dynamic and will be shaped collaboratively based on your assignment and aspirations.
 



  





 We believe your career journey should start in a place of strength and familiarity. Where do you want to begin? Perhaps focusing on:
 


* **Cloud Architecture**
* **System Development**
* **DevOps/SRE**
* **Data Engineering**
* **Generative AI**



  





**At Pyyne, you are the architect of your career.** 




  





**About You:** 




 🌟 Curious & Energetic – You’re excited to learn, try new things, and explore creative ways to make an impact. You bring energy and positivity to everything you do.
 



  





 🤝 People-Oriented – You love connecting with others, building relationships, and helping people grow. Supporting colleagues and candidates comes naturally to you.
 



  





 🎯 Driven & Proactive – You don’t wait for opportunities to come to you, you create them. You enjoy shaping processes, testing ideas, and seeing them through to success.
 



  





 🌍 Open-Minded & Inclusive – You value diversity and are passionate about creating environments where everyone feels empowered to contribute and shine.
 



  





 💡 Creative & Resourceful – You’re not afraid to think outside the box. You find innovative solutions and enjoy bringing fresh ideas to life.
 



  





 🗣️ Communicative – You’re confident sharing your ideas, giving feedback, and keeping everyone in the loop. Clear, friendly communication is one of your superpowers.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications:** 



* BSc in Engineering or Technology and 3+ years of experience



 (OR)
 


* MSc in Engineering or Technology



  





**Language:** 



* English - Must
* Swedish - Preferred

title: Senior Test Automation Engineer
description:
We are looking for a
 **Senior Test Automation Engineer** 
 to lead and drive test automation, quality strategy, and performance validation in an
 **IoT domain (Smart Buildings)** 
 . This role focuses on building high-quality automated test systems, ensuring performance, reliability, and scalability from
 **edge devices to cloud services** 
 .
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain advanced test automation frameworks and test suites using Java (Spring).
* Build comprehensive automated test suites that are fully integrated with metrics, logging, and monitoring for full observability and quality tracking.
* Own and drive performance testing and performance improvement initiatives, including bottleneck analysis and system optimization validation.
* Design and execute end-to-end performance validation scenarios covering edge devices, gateways, and cloud services.
* Integrate test automation and performance tests into CI/CD pipelines with clear quality gates.
* Work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) environments for test infrastructure and system validation.
* Use Terraform as Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to provision and manage scalable test environments.
* Collaborate with development, platform, and product teams to improve system testability, reliability, and performance.
* Analyze test results, performance metrics, and failures, driving root-cause analysis and continuous improvement.
* Define testing standards, best practices, and quality strategy across teams.


**Requirements**
* Senior-level experience in test automation or software engineering in test roles.
* Strong Java coding skills and experience building and maintaining test automation frameworks.
* Proven experience designing large-scale automated test suites with built-in observability (metrics, monitoring, reporting).
* Strong experience with performance testing, performance analysis, and system optimization validation.
* Experience testing distributed systems, preferably in IoT or edge-to-cloud architectures.
* Hands-on experience with GCP or similar cloud platforms.
* Experience using Terraform or other Infrastructure as Code tools.
* Solid experience integrating tests into CI/CD pipelines and enforcing quality gates.
* Strong understanding of software architecture, testing strategies, and quality engineering practices.


****Nice to Have****
* Experience testing systems involving hardware devices, sensors, or embedded systems.
* Experience with containerized and orchestrated environments (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with load, stress, soak, and scalability testing methodologies.
* Experience working in large-scale, high-throughput, or mission-critical systems.


 All set to make a difference? Click the apply button now!

title: Regional Sales Representative, Northern Europe
description:
**Your Title:** 
 Regional Sales Representative, Northern Europe
   

  

**Job Location:** 
 Sweden - Danderyd or Remote in Sweden, Norway, Finland
   

  

**Division:** 
 Civil Construction Field Solutions CCFS
   

  

*Are you looking to be a part of an award-winning organization and one of the fastest growing technology companies that is transforming the construction landscape with innovative technology solutions?*
*Join our team! We will offer your versatile tasks in a diverse, inspiring and dynamic working environment with great colleagues. Apply as soon as possible! Please, submit your CV/application only in English.*
 In this position you will have a very specific focus on CEC Machine control solutions and Connected Site promotion with a primary focus on Northern Europe. You will be deeply involved in developing solid business relationships with Equipment Dealers.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 You will provide sales and application support for distributors and potentially end users in the CEC product portfolio You will:
   

  

* Increase market share through the development of Connected Site solutions to existing accounts and new customers. You will also be able to develop customer interest on Trimble Continuum solutions to develop sales on the entire CEC solutions
* Sell through select and perhaps multiple channels of distribution and have large project involvement, and will develop strategic key end-user relationships to ensure the successful sale of all Trimble products and services. You will have a strong field presence across the Nordic region
* Be responsible for ongoing dealer development through the introduction, follow-up and ongoing involvement in Trimble’s channel development programs/workshops.


**Primary Responsibilities**
 You will report to the Nordic Regional Sales Manager. Together with the Regional Sales Manager, you will participate in the development and implementation of regionally assigned sales plans. You will be in interface with distributor management, operations, sales, service and support staff.
   

  

**You Will**
* Develop strong long term business development with regional equipment dealers and implementation of Trimble Technology Outlets
* Conduct on site distributor training and job site demonstrations together with the application engineers
* Be in interface with major regional accounts
* Conduct joint sales presentations with focus on Educational Presentations
* Drive the Annual Review Meetings with key accounts in each dealer territory
* Assist in the identification, procurement and subsequent training of distribution sales and application personnel
* Evaluate marketplace potential for all served markets and customer segments using Data Analytics services as available
* Assist in the development of and participation in, specific technical communications and training requirements such as Trimble Dimensions, Boot Camps, Construction News, and others
* Ensure new product release involvement by all dealers including local strategy, training and proper inventory
* Provide input on competitive products and activities primarily to the CCFS Business Area
* Assist in the identification and development of new distribution.


**What Skills, Experience And Knowledge You Should Bring**
* Proven experience of successful consultative sales
* Experience in Channel development and management
* Business, sales, market and domain knowledge in survey, civil engineering and / or construction
* Ideally experienced in Technology solutions for Construction
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability and willingness to travel up to+/- 50%
* Proficient knowledge of civil construction applications
* Product knowledge is a bonus
* Strong collaboration and relationship building skills
* Ability to prioritize, organize and manage multiple projects at one time
* Fluency in English and one Scandinavian language. Additional Nordic language skills are a bonus.


**About Our CCFS Division**
 Trimble's Civil Construction Field Solutions division focuses on providing advanced technology solutions to enhance productivity, accuracy, and efficiency in civil construction projects. This division integrates hardware and software tools to support the entire construction lifecycle, from initial site assessment and planning through to design, construction, and ongoing maintenance.
   

  

 Key offerings include machine control systems, site positioning systems, and software for project management and collaboration. These tools enable precise grading, excavation, paving, and site management, which help contractors and engineers streamline workflows, reduce rework, and improve overall project outcomes. For more information on currently developed products, see https://heavyindustry.trimble.com
   

  

**About Trimble**
 Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit: https://www.trimble.com/en
   

  

**Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment**
 We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
   

  

 We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.
   

  

**Trimble’s Privacy Policy**
****How to Apply:****
 Please submit an online application for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply Now’ button located in this posting.
   

  

****Posting Date****
 09/26/2025
   

  

****Application Deadline:****
 Applications could be accepted until at least 30 days from the posting date.
   

  

****Join a Values-Driven Team: Belong, Grow, Innovate.****
 At Trimble, our core values of Belong, Grow, and Innovate aren't just words—they're the foundation of our culture. We foster an environment where you are seen, heard, and valued (Belong); where you have an opportunity to build a career and drive our collective growth (Grow); and where your innovative ideas shape the future (Innovate). We believe in empowering local teams to create impactful strategies, ensuring our global vision resonates with every individual. Become part of a team where your contributions truly matter.
   

  

 Trimble’s Privacy Policy
   

  

 If you need assistance or would like to request an accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact AskPX@px.trimble.com.

title: Product Cybersecurity Consultant
description:
Vill du vara med och göra vardagen säkrare för människor genom smartare, tryggare digitala produkter?
   

  

 Vi på HiQ i Stockholm bygger upp ett starkt Cybersecurity-team och söker dig som vill kombinera djup teknisk förståelse med känsla för helhet och affär.
   

  

 Här jobbar du i framkant med cybersäkerhet, från helt nya satsningar där säkerhet designas in från början, till kritiska skeden där våra rekommendationer gör tydlig skillnad. Du får arbeta med olika kunder, branscher och mognadsnivåer, och kan på riktigt sätta avtryck i hur området formas framåt.
   

  

**I rollen som Product Cybersecurity Consultant** 
 är du en nyckelspelare i våra kunders produkt- och systemutveckling. I praktiken innebär det till exempel att du utformar och granskar säkerhetsarkitektur för inbyggda system, IoT-lösningar eller komplexa mjukvaruplattformar. Du genomför threat modeling och riskanalyser som påverkar faktiska beslut, och du stöttar utvecklingsteam i val av lösningar kring exempelvis kryptering, autentisering och kommunikation. Du hjälper också kunderna att omsätta standarder och regelverk till konkreta krav, arbetssätt och designval.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har minst tre års erfarenhet inom något eller flera av följande områden: Cybersecurity, Application Security, OT Security, Embedded Cyber, Technical Cybersecurity, System Architecture eller Product Security. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska, både i tal och skrift, och du är van att arbeta nära utveckling eller produktutveckling.
   

  

 Det är en fördel om du har erfarenhet av embedded systems eller embedded Linux, system security, IoT-säkerhet, ICS eller Industrial Control Systems, kryptografi, realtidsoperativsystem samt kommunikationsprotokoll som CAN, CAN-FD, MQTT eller Ethernet. Har du dessutom kommit i kontakt med standarder och regelverk som ISO/IEC 62443-serien, ISO/SAE 21434 eller 24089, UNECE R155 eller R156, ISO/IEC 81001-5-1 eller CRA så är det ett extra plus.
   

  

 Som person trivs du i samarbeten och gillar dialogen med både utvecklingsteam och beslutsfattare. Du har ett genuint intresse för hur saker fungerar under huven, delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och är lika nyfiken på att lära dig av andra.
   

  

**Varför HiQ?**
 Hos HiQ är du konsult med stor möjlighet att forma din egen resa. Du får arbeta i varierade uppdrag med olika branscher och teknikstackar, tillsammans med kollegor som är allt från utvecklare, testare och hackers till designers och projektledare. Gemensamt är att vi drivs av teknik, nyfikenhet och viljan att skapa lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Här finns goda möjligheter att fördjupa dig, certifiera dig och utvecklas både tekniskt och i konsultrollen. Vi är runt 1700 kollegor i fyra länder, men du märker snabbt att det är nära till andra som brinner för samma saker som du, oavsett om det handlar om cybersäkerhet, löpning, schack, musik eller hemmabyggda tangentbord.
   

  

 Intresserad?
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer om rollen, teamet eller våra uppdrag inom cybersäkerhet i Stockholm. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och ser fram emot att höra från dig.

title: AI & Data Science Senior Manager, Stockholm
description:
*Would you like to help clients transform their business by* 
*identifying and unlocking value through AI & Data? Accenture Strategy & Consulting practice is looking for a
 **Senior Manager** 
 for our AI & Data team in Stockholm.*
**Description of practice and role:**
 Accenture Strategy & Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they look to the future. Within AI & Data, we help our clients transform their business through advanced analytics, modern data solutions, machine learning, GenAI and agentic AI – designing and implementing scalable, production grade AI solutions that deliver real business value. Alongside strategic business advisory, we are also the world’s largest team of data scientists, data engineers, and experts in machine learning and AI. In Sweden our team consists of more than 30 AI professionals within Strategy & Consulting, and a large extended network within Technology & Song.
   

  

 We are looking for a senior leader to drive delivery excellence, set long-term strategy, and act as a trusted advisor to senior client stakeholders. As we enter our next growth phase focused on agentic, AI-native transformation, you will shape how advanced AI and data solutions are designed and delivered across complex, enterprise environments. Read more about the AI & Data practice & team here.
   

  

**In the role you will:**
- Lead the design and delivery of large-scale AI, GenAI and agentic solutions, from data platforms and MLOps/LLMOps to model deployment and enterprise integration.

- Set technical direction and governance, ensuring secure, scalable, and high-quality engineering across multiple teams and initiatives.

- Translate complex AI and data capabilities into clear business value for executive stakeholders.

- Guide clients through AI-driven transformation, including operating model, organizational, and technology change.

- Drive growth and sales activities through client engagements, strategic pursuits, and leading content creation and messaging for CXO pitches.

**Who we are looking for:**
 We are looking for an experienced leader with a strong technical background in Data & AI, who can lead and advise complex, large-scale engagements, mentor and develop other leaders as well as act as a trusted strategic advisor to senior client stakeholders.
   

  

 Specifically, we expect you to bring:
   

  

  

- 10+ years of experience in AI, data, and advanced analytics

- Deep AI & Data knowledge, extensive work and academic experience within AI solution modelling, data platform architectures, and cloud technologies

- Ability to abstract, solve and explain complex problems and navigate both the business and technical dimensions of a Data & AI transformation project

- Experienced in managing the full Data & AI tech delivery lifecycle - from business needs to production - ready solutions and business adoption - creating business value

- Strong leadership experience in building, coaching and developing high-performing teams fostering a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing

- Executive-level stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technology into business outcomes

- Commercial leadership experience, including shaping major engagements and driving business growth

- Deep expertise in one or two industries, with senior advisory and transformation experience

**What we offer:**
- Great development opportunities to build your professional career based on your own aspirations, having support from your own mentor.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization - including methodologies, knowledge databases, expert networks, and benchmarks

- Leadership roles and development with mentoring of senior colleagues and experts

- Work alongside our clients in their organizations and drive comprehensive, meaningful, and transformative projects

- Competitive salary terms, bonus program, health insurance and fringe benefits

- Work-life balance: good arrangements to combine free time and family life with work. We offer active support for mental health.

- Personal mentor to guide your growth and career within Accenture´s global possibilities

- Market-leading expertise and talented colleagues to work alongside

**About Strategy & Consulting:**
 Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. To stay agile in a world dominated by change, the C-suite must keep the core business running while simultaneously identifying and investing in the new. Accenture Strategy & Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology.
   

  

 Accenture Strategy & Consulting consists of a wide range of business functions and industry groups. Read more about our business functions and industries here.
   

  

**Does this appeal to you?**
 Please apply and attach both your CV and application letter, preferably also your grade transcripts.
   

  

 Application deadline: February 28th 2026, we review applications on an ongoing basis so feel free to submit your application before the deadline.
   

  

 For questions related to the role or team:
   

  

 Petter Bohman - AI & Data Director - LinkedIn Profile
   

  

 For questions related to the recruitment process:
   

  

 Anne Kallaskari - Recruiting Lead, anne.kallaskari@accenture.com

title: Finance & BizOps - EPD
description:
**TL;DR** 
 You will serve as the strategic finance partner for our Engineering, Product & Design teams, architecting our commercial relationships with major AI model providers and optimizing cloud economics to drive efficient technical scaling.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software development, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to transform the way the digital world operates. Over 2 million people in more than 200 countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate tasks, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Hyperscaler Strategist & Deal Architect: You understand the nuances of usage-based pricing and token economics. You are a seasoned negotiator who can align internal teams and go toe-to-toe with technical vendors to structure deals that balance unit economics, committed spend, and flexibility.
* Technical & Analytical Authority: You have the "Excel expert" modeling chops, data skills (SQL, Hex, BI tools), and technical literacy to gain immediate credibility with Engineering leaders. You can easily translate technical concepts/decisions into financial impact.
* Service-First Partner: You bring a proactive, "can-do" attitude to every interaction and are comfortable owning the operationally tedious work required to ensure clean handoffs between technical teams, finance, and procurement.
* Finance & BizOps Veteran: You bring 8+ years of relevant experience, including 4+ years in strategic finance and BizOps supporting R&D/EPD at a SaaS company. Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Finance, Business, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar).


**What You’ll Do**
* Drive Hyperscaler 360 Strategy: You will orchestrate the strategy for Lovable’s relationships with model providers, aligning cross-functional teams to ensure we are building strategic alliances, not just buying tokens.
* Architect High-Value Partnerships: You will lead commercial negotiations with LLM providers and technical partners, securing competitive pricing, favorable terms, and capacity commitments that protect our margins as we scale.
* Run Financial Operations for EPD: You will implement rigorous FinOps practices, linking model performance and usage data to financial outcomes to ensure every dollar spent on compute generates tangible value.
* Drive EPD Planning & Investment: You will own headcount planning, budgeting, and investment tradeoffs for the EPD org to enable fast execution without waste.
* Build an AI-Native Function: You will reject the status quo of manual spreadsheet work by integrating AI agents and automation into the finance workflow, building a modern infrastructure that moves at the speed of Lovable’s AI platform.

title: Supplier Manager

 Supplier Manager

 Intermediate

 100% commitment, on-site
