title: Antenna Engineer
description:
Kaelus is currently looking for a full-time Antenna engineer to join our innovative engineering team in Täby. In joining us you will play an important part to bring next-generation antenna solutions to the market. The ideal candidate should enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where flexibility is key to success.


#### **About Kaelus**


Kaelus is a international company with more than 40 years’ experience, operating in the global Mobile Communications market. Being part of our team, you contribute to setting a new standard of excellence in Antenna System performance for 5G and beyond, empowering the connected society of tomorrow. We do this by providing next generation Antenna, RF Conditioning and PIM Test & Measurement solutions that are tailored to customer needs. Always backed by excellent PIM Performance.


Our customers can count on us to be innovative, flexible, reliable and act with integrity. This means that we must excel at meeting quality standards for all products and services throughout their lifecycles.


### **Job Title: Antenna engineer**


#### **Key Responsibilities**

* In assigned projects be the interface of Antenna Engineering to enable delivery of all project phases and ensure Time to Market is as per company strategic objectives
* Provide Antenna RF product design through simulation and laboratory work, with verification and implementation on key projects for new and re-engineering of Kaelus Group products

#### **What you will be doing:**


* Creation and management of antenna RF design, 3D models and PCB drawings using for example HFSS and Matlab
* Laboratory work including tuning and testing
* Plan and execute RF testing
* Support for design reviews
* Support procurement and management of design samples
* Support prototype building / assembly
* Support for qualification of new suppliers Improving design and qualification procedures and formalising methods
* Investigation of new suppliers for existing and new technologies for cost reduction
* Investigation of new materials and processes
* Reporting to the Engineering Manager/Project Manager on daily and weekly objectives
* Providing support for Quality activities in response to customer inputs and internal audits and CARs.
* Any other ad hoc duties requested by Engineering

#### **Education, Skills & Experience**


* Master of Science degree in electrical engineering and 2+ years working experience with antenna design or equivalent
* Working knowledge in designing dual polarized antenna elements including feed structures and phase shifter in the 500-6000MHz frequency range
* Experience from working with 3D simulations software, preferably HFSS
* Experience from working with network analyser
* Experience with hand soldering is meriting
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office

#### **Personal Qualities**


* Good communication skills; as interfacing with many different work groups
* Disciplined approach to tasks set
* Self-motivated to carry out defined tasks with a reasonable amount of independence
* Eagerness to develop technical knowledge
* Practical, dextrous with attention to detail
* Enthusiastic
* English speaking, as we work and interact in an international environment

#### **Location**


Täby, Stockholm County, Sweden


#### **Employment**


Full-time, monthly salary.


#### **Starting time**


As soon as possible.


#### **Application submission**


Welcome with your application - Send it to Career at Kaelus. Career@kaelus.com


By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read the Kaelus Recruitment Privacy Policy and you thereby grant your consent to Kaelus processing your personal data in accordance with that Kaelus Recruitment Privacy Policy. You have the right to withdraw your consent at any time by contacting Kaelus

title: AI Engineer
description:
At Bim.com, we connect the people who build with the products they build with. e are on a journey to digitise the construction industry for a more sustainable future. **Are you ready to join this exciting journey as our newest AI Engineer?**


Together with us, you will make a difference – both for our customers and the planet. We offer you the unique opportunity to be part of a small team within a global company of 160 employees. Join our team building cutting-edge AI systems to automate LCA (Life Cycle Assessment), sustainability data workflows and product information management. You will be a part of a new team that is growing the AI agenda together. As our new AI Engineer, you will rapidly grow your expertise by working with cutting-edge technology and developing innovative systems with significant real-world impact.

**As our new AI Engineer, you will…**

* Design and experiment with LLM-based workflows to handle complex sustainability and product datasets
* Use cursor or similar - you'll hardly write any code from scratch yourself
* Develop and maintain AI-driven tools and systems for sustainability automation and product data
* Work closely with a small, passionate team at the forefront of AI and environmental impact
* Constantly learn and apply new research, techniques, and tools in the AI space

**We believe that you …**

* Have 5 years of experience in software engineering or equivalent
* Have at least one year of experience working with building LLM apps and AI workflow as well as experience and strong skills in Python
* Can demonstrate a well-developed personal project that shows the ability to design and implement AI systems.
* Are curious by design and a continuous learner
* Comfortable in an international team with English as your daily language


Don’t fit every single box? We know that applying for a job can be intimidating and that experience comes in many forms. If this role looks like a great next step for you, please apply! We’d love to hear your story, even if you don’t meet 100% of the criteria.

**Practicalities**


This position is located in Malmö and offers a hybrid work model. We love the mix between meeting at the office, and having the possibility to explore what works best for you. However, for the right candidate, we are open to a remote set up.

**What we offer our employees**

* **The core:** A startup mentality within a stable global company, but small enough for everyone to have voice in shaping our company’s future (160+ employees). We live by our values: *Raise it, Do it, Together.*
* **Flexibility:** A genuine hybrid model. This role is stationed in the Malmö office, and we love the office energy, but sometimes the home office fits better. For this role we require 4 days per week at the office.
* **Growth:** We invest in your development and encourage experimentation.
* **Inclusion:** A diverse workplace where different perspectives drive innovation.

**More about** **Bim.com**


The industry is on a journey to build better. To succeed, the people who build need better information about the products they use. And better access to it. Bim.com is the central source of product information for the construction industry and the engine behind an ecosystem of software, tools, and services that enable the information to be used at all different stages of a construction project. By doing so, Bim.com enables those who build to make informed decisions, work smarter, and enhance the overall efficiency and quality of the construction project.


Ready to join the journey? We can’t wait to meet you!

title: Assembly Test and Verification Engineer
description:
### **Role description**


We are looking for an Assembly Test and Verification Engineer to assemble, integrate, and verify prototypes and products for advanced mechatronic systems. You will be involved across the product lifecycle—from early design phases through testing and release—working closely with design, quality, and production stakeholders.


This assignment suits someone who enjoys hands-on engineering, structured testing, and cross-functional collaboration.

### **Responsibilities**

* Assemble and integrate prototypes and products, combining mechanical, pneumatic, electrical, and software components
* Execute safety, functional, and performance testing at component and system level
* Support test/verification activities from early development through release readiness
* Contribute to test processes, test documentation, and continuous improvement of lab ways of working
* Troubleshoot physical hardware issues and support root-cause investigations
* Support lab operations related to rapid prototyping and additive manufacturing activities
* Mentor and support other engineers within the lab/test environment

### **Requirements**

* Master’s degree in Engineering (or other relevant academic background)
* Minimum 5 years of experience within Assembly Test and Verification
* Broad technical understanding of mechatronic systems
* Experience assembling and testing equipment where multiple disciplines are integrated (mechanical, electrical, software)
* Strong problem-solving and hands-on troubleshooting skills for physical hardware
* Ability to thrive in early-stage development and navigate a large, complex organization
* Team-oriented mindset and willingness to learn new techniques and working methods
* Excellent communication skills in English

### **Meritorious**

* Experience working in prototype or lab environments
* Experience contributing to improvements of test processes and lab operations
* Experience mentoring or supporting other engineers

### **Start / Duration**

**Start:** 2026-02-02  

**Duration:** Until 2026-08-01

### **Location**


Stockholm (hybrid)

### **About Rasulson Consulting**


Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Enterprise Solutions Engineer - EU (German Speaking)
description:
**About ElevenLabs**
--------------------


ElevenLabs is a research and product company defining the frontier of audio AI. Millions of people use our technology to read articles, voice over videos, and restore voices lost to disability. Leading developers and enterprises worldwide use ElevenLabs to build intelligent agents for support, sales, and education.


We launched in January 2023 with the first AI model to cross the threshold of human-like speech. In January 2025, we raised a $180 million Series C round, valuing the company at $3.3 billion. By September 2025, that valuation doubled to $6.6 billion as we surpassed $200 million ARR in under three years.


Our mission is to build the most important audio AI platform in the world, solve AI audio intelligence, and make information accessible in any voice, language, or sound.


Our core offerings are our Creative Platform and the Agents Platform, powered by proprietary Text to Speech, Speech to Text, and conversational AI models.


We are just getting started. If you want to work hard and create lasting impact, we would like to hear from you.

**How we work**
---------------

* **High-velocity:** Rapid experimentation, lean autonomous teams, and minimal bureaucracy.
* **Impact not job titles:** We don’t have job titles. Instead, it’s about the impact you have. No task is above or beneath you.
* **AI first:** We use AI to move faster with higher-quality results. We do this across the whole company—from engineering to growth to operations.
* **Excellence everywhere:** Everything we do should match the quality of our AI models.
* **Global team:** We prioritize your talent, not your location.

**What we offer**
-----------------

* **Innovative culture:** You’ll be part of a generational opportunity to define the trajectory of AI, surrounded by a team pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
* **Growth paths:** Joining ElevenLabs means joining a dynamic team with countless opportunities to drive impact - beyond your immediate role and responsibilities.
* **Learning & development**: ElevenLabs proactively supports professional development through an annual discretionary stipend.
* **Social travel**: We also provide an annual discretionary stipend to meet up with colleagues each year, however you choose.
* **Annual company offsite:** Each year, we bring the entire team together in a new location - past offsites have included Croatia and Italy.
* **Co-working**: If you’re not located near one of our main hubs, we offer a monthly co-working stipend.

**About the role**
------------------


As a Solutions Engineer, you'll work as part of a driven team to unlock the full potential of our voice AI platform for a growing customer base. Your mission is to efficiently scale our technical solutions to many enterprise customers, both directly and by improving our internal processes and supporting our sales teams.


As a Solutions Engineer, you can expect to:

* Collaborate strategically with Account Executives to enhance the technical aspects of the sales process.
* Work directly with technical contacts from our customers and prospective customers to provide bespoke support and architect solutions.
* Craft compelling technical demonstrations that clearly communicate our product's value proposition.
* Create technical enablement resources that amplify our sales team's effectiveness and technical fluency.
* Build self-service tools and documentation that empower customers to implement solutions independently.
* Identify opportunities to productize common integration patterns or features, and work with our product teams to make these real!

**Requirements**
----------------


We're looking for exceptional individuals who excel at working with customers on technical problems and excited to work with us to scale this efficiently. You'll thrive with us if you:

* Are passionate about AI, technology and ElevenLabs products.
* Enjoy working directly with customers, iterating on solutions and providing tailored support
* Have a talent for identifying patterns that can be standardized and scaled.
* Have strong empathy for customers, sales and product teams.
* Have a strong technical background in order to help customers architect integration between our solutions and their existing solutions
* Experience working with customers. It’s ok if you only worked with customers in student clubs or side projects, as long as you are interested in working closely with them on a technical capacity
* Proficiency in Python, inclusive of a deep understanding of software development, software architecture, and common integration patterns.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to adapt messaging to different audiences.
* The successful candidate must be fluent in German to effectively communicate with key partners and stakeholders.

**Location**
------------


This role is remote and can be executed globally. If you prefer, you can work from our offices in Bangalore, Dublin, London, New York, San Francisco, Tokyo, and Warsaw.

  

#LI-Remote

title: Senior Engineer, Photonics IC Automation and Test Design
description:
**Coherent Corp.** is the global leader in photonics, designing and manufacturing advanced laser, optical, and material technologies used by customers worldwide across industrial, communications, electronics, and instrumentation markets.


With a broad global footprint and deep engineering capability, we combine advanced manufacturing, applied innovation, and customer collaboration to deliver high-performance solutions that enable critical technologies and solve complex, real-world challenges.


***About Coherent in Sweden***  

*Coherent Corp. Sweden is where cutting-edge photonics meets everyday collaboration. As Sweden’s only full-scale indium phosphide wafer fabrication facility, we design, manufacture, and test some of the world’s fastest optical chips—all under one roof—enabling our engineers to see their work progress from wafer to finished product, supporting data centres, AI infrastructure, and global communications.*

**Location:** Jarfalla, Onsite | **Employment Type:** Permanent, Full-time


We are seeking a Senior Engineer, Photonics IC Automation and Test Design to lead the planning, execution, and optimisation of automated optical and electrical testing for photonic ICs and opto-electronic systems. The role focuses on validating functionality, quality, and performance while designing robust, efficient, and scalable test solutions for development and manufacturing environments.


Working closely with a highly collaborative R&D team, you will play a key role in advancing test automation strategies, improving test throughput, and developing innovative test methods across the product life-cycle.


**ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Plan, execute, and analyse automated optical and electrical tests for opto-electronic components and systems to ensure performance, quality, and reliability.
* Design, develop, and maintain automated test setups, including hardware, instrumentation, test flows, and measurement sequences for characterisation and verification.
* Drive test efficiency, repeatability, and robustness, ensuring test stations operate accurately and consistently.
* Analyse test data, interpret technical requirements and standards, and document results clearly and accurately.
* Represent the Product Development Test Team across the full component and OSA development lifecycle, from concept through manufacturing readiness.
* Collaborate with R&D and hardware engineering teams to develop **new automated test methods** and continuously improve existing test processes.
* Support project planning, performance requirement reviews, and product specifications across development phases.
* Troubleshoot complex optical and electrical performance issues and lead root-cause analysis to improve test quality and yield.

**ABOUT YOU**

* MSc or PhD in Optoelectronics, Electronics, Engineering Physics, or a related discipline.
* 5 plus years’ experience in optoelectronic or electronic device development and testing.
* Strong hands-on experience in automated testing of opto-/electronic devices for RF and DC applications, with a focus on test system design rather than software development.
* Solid laboratory background using advanced optical and electrical measurement instrumentation.
* Strong foundation in applied mathematics and physics, including device characterisation and statistical analysis of test and measurement data.

**What We Offer?**  

  

Coherent values its people and offers a competitive market-aligned salary, bonus scheme, and six weeks’ annual leave for this position, along with a comprehensive benefits package. You will have the opportunity to work at the cutting edge of technology, collaborating closely with colleagues across product development and production in a highly skilled and innovative environment.


Current employees who wish to apply should submit a cover letter detailing their interest in the position and how their skills and experience align with the requirements of the role.


Applications for this tole close COB on **Monday, 23 February** . If you require any adjustment to the application process, please reach out to Alyxandra.Highland@coherent.com


  
ABOUT US
  
Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
  

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.
  
ABOUT THE TEAM

title: CAE Engineer – Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise within IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Apply today, selection and interviews are ongoing.


We are now looking for a **CAE Engineer – Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics** for one of our clients in Göteborg-

**Assignment Details**  

Support the Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics team in studying current and future platform concepts.


Work closely with our Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics team and attribute teams to align suspension system performance.


Build and analyze kinematic models for package studies.


Perform Kinematics & Compliance (K&C) analysis on suspension layouts.

* Lap simulations.
* ADAMS simulations.
* Build ADAMS RT models.
* Improve queuing in driving simulator.
* Improve brake/steering feel in driving simulator.

**Qualifications and skills required for the role**

* Minimum B.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering
* Minimum 5-year experience from Chassis System Development.
* A strong understanding of technical development of chassis systems and concepts.
* To be able to balance attribute requirements (mainly NVH, Vehicle Dynamics, Durability, Corrosion and Brakes).
* Experience of multiple suspension systems layouts.
* Vehicle Dynamics understanding. Personal attributes
* Positive and agile attitude and interested in finding solutions together with other people/teams.
* Willing to help others and to ask for help when needed.
* Have an openness and awareness of Asian, European and other cultures. IT/SW requirements MS Office, Adams, Matlab Simulink, ADAMS RT, Lap simulations, VI grade, s/w set up for simulator DIM 250, Autohawk 64.

**Other**  

**Assignment Duration**;2026-03-02 to 2027-02-26

**Location**: Göteborg  

  

**Application Deadline:** 2026-01-30


Please apply directly through our system with:

* Your updated CV in english
* Availability to start the assignment


In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.

**Please note:** We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

**Offer continuously:** Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Embedded Software Application Engineer
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.


Professional Galaxy is looking for a **Embedded Software Application Engineer** on behalf of our client.

**FUNCTION OWNER**  

Are you an experienced and curious Electrical & Electronics, Embedded SW engineer with a passion for technical solutions? Do you like understanding and exploring new domains in product development and sharing your passion with your colleagues? Good, then continue reading, we have a great opportunity for you.  

  

**What kind of challenge? You might wonder.**  

In recent years the demand for integrated software solutions, together with its services, has constantly been increasing. The opportunities and challenges that lies in front of us are no longer just on the vehicle side, but nowadays also on the cybersecurity and communication between vehicle and back-office. Functions in the vehicle plays a vital role.  

It is in the middle of all this that Buses needs you. You who are creative, driven and can lead and guide this development from the driver’s seat through collaboration, enthusiasm, and passion.  

  

**This is us, your new colleagues**  

Our group currently consists of 13 committed engineers, divided into 2 teams and 2 sites, with different professional backgrounds, interests, and history but with a common mindset: Develop ourselves and our products! On a constant basis, we try to improve our quality assurance and actively work with brainstorming & knowledge sharing in effort to stay competitive and feel proud.  

  

Our group plays a big and important role in the value stream of Vehicle control where we are responsible for the development and integration of new and existing functions and features in our vehicles. Having a global responsibility, the solutions developed within the team can be found in our buses all over the world, helping millions of people every day to reach their destination. Imagine that as a legacy!  

  

In our global responsibility, we cooperate with our sites in Mexico and Brazil, as well as with our Volvo-owned brand Prevost in North America, as well as our body builders.  

Together, we secure knowledge transfer and competence development in an effort to become an even higher performing team with passionate people.  

  

**What can we propose?**  

The role is within the Vehicle Control group, where you will contribute to our world-class development and integration of electrical system solutions with the aim to reach our Zero City vision: zero emissions, zero noise, zero accidents and zero congestion. You will be part of the development within the Function development and Application area in our vehicles and will work closely together with different stakeholders in order to achieve our customer’s expectations. You will further work with solving bugs and issues that is raised from our projects, plant, customer or other internal departments.  

  

**REQUIREMENTS**  

* Be the expert of the assigned End User Functions and related use cases.
* Knowledge of the Transport Solution End User Function structure.
* Automotive domain knowledge.
* Knowledge about vehicle feature roadmaps.
* Ability to develop and manage requirements according to our requirements management processes.
* Ability to analyze and solve complex problems.
* General knowledge of vehicle development and verification.
* ISO26262 (FuSa/ HARA), Cyber security (TARA) knowledge is a must, as you will be working closely with our FuSa and CS teams to drive these for your functions.
* SystemWeaver knowledge is a must
* Preferably knowledge of our tools. Would be good if you have specific experience, such as KOLA, knowledge in KOLA logic is advantage.
* Worked in Jira, and been part of Agile WoW.


This role further require you to work with non end user functions, such as system functionality.  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**  

* Develop, manage and own the End User Function Requirements for all variants, use-cases and applicable regulations. All phases of the function life cycle should be considered.
* Global responsibility for commonality and reusability of the functionality between products, brands and markets.
* Participate in balancing and handshake of the Transport Solution and feature requirements related to the End User Function.
* Responsible for breaking down feature requirements into End User Function requirements.
* Review, handshake and secure commitment with all stakeholders for the End User Function Requirements. This also require alignment with other Function owners.
* Communicating all changes regarding scope and functional variants of the End User Function with the End User Function architect for approval.
* Evaluate and review applicable function concepts.
* Plan and participate in quality and safety ensuring activities, including screening


Lead the work with Hazard Analysis, Functional safety Concept, and Safety Case including associated reviews and independent assessments.**Other Information :**

**Assignment Duration:** 2026-02-02 to 2026-12-31

**Application Deadline** : 2026-01-29


Please apply directly through our system with:

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.

**Please note:** We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: Azure data architect
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise within IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Apply today, selection and interviews are ongoing.

**Domain Architect**  

We are looking for an **Azure data architect**, with a good overall understanding of available services in the Azure Analytics stack and a demonstrated experience on Databricks. This person is required to take the technical lead in the Group data domain area in the role of domain architect. We need this person to keep everything together but also to have practical experience to actually dive in and setup different environments & services.  

  

**What you will do:**  

As Data Architect, you will ensure that the products delivered by your stable team is aligned with our Group global target architecture. To support this position, we are looking for a Data Architect Azure with a good overall understanding of available services in the Azure Analytics stack, an advanced experience on Databricks. This person will work with DPO, Data Analyst, Data Engineer & Data Scientist from stable team, but also Architect community to define architect with right quality, relevant business value and maintainability in long term.


Moreover, he/she also needs leadership skills to take the technical lead role and discussion with Business Stakeholders and Enterprise Architecture.  

* You provide technical leadership, you participate in development efforts, and you represent the full internal and external capabilities of the platform.
* You will be an active member of the architect’s guild to oversee data management process and provide guidance and direction to development teams
* You are responsible for the design, documentation of the solution in your domain.
* You have experiences on Databricks, ADLS storage, SQL DB, ADF and Power BI.
* You have experiences in defining and owning end-to-end scalable Data Architecture taking into account enterprise architecture and industry standards.
* You are used to develop, document and maintain logical and physical data models.

  

**As a Domain Architect:**  

In addition to being the Data Architect of a Stable Team, you are in charge of supporting the DPAO (Digital Product Area Owner) in addressing the requests of the DPAM (Area Manager). You define the roadmap and support the Stable Teams in the priorization of their backlogs. You have constant focus on the alignment of the products with the Group target architecture. You are in charge of demonstrating its value to your business stakeholders.**Assignment Duration**: 2026-01-29 to 2026-12-31

**Location:** Göteborg  

  

**Application Deadline:** 2026-01-28


Please apply directly through our system with:

* Your updated CV in english
* Availability to start the assignment


In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.

**Please note:** We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

**Offer continuously:** Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Fullstack Django or Python
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision - to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions. ⚡
   

  

 We’re now expanding our website team with an
 **Fullstack Engineer** 
 . Are you ready to join the Power Shift?
   

  

**About The Role & The Team**
 As our
 **Fullstack Engineer (with a frontend focus)** 
 in the Website team, you’ll be part of a talented and ambitious agile team. Together you’ll design and implement technical solutions for Svea Solar’s website and related areas, ensuring a seamless experience between our site and our smart energy platform
 *Sunbeam* 
 .
   

  

 You’ll work closely with another Teach lead, a frontend engineer, an analyst, and a product manager, reporting to our Engineering Manager Anna. We follow a collaboration-first approach, working three days a week from our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* Build and maintain both frontend and backend features, with a strong focus on frontend.
* Develop modern, accessible, and semantically correct websites using HTML5 and CSS3 (SASS).
* Write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code in TypeScript/JavaScript and React.js.
* Design and implement REST APIs and integrations with our CMS written in Python.
* Collaborate with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers to create functional and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural discussions and best practices, supporting long-term scalability and event-driven design.


 Are we a match?
   

  

**We’re Looking For You Who…**
* Value team success over personal success and thrive in a collaborative dynamic environment.
* Have at least 5 years of professional experience in software development, including at least 2 years in backend.
* Have strong experience with: Python, TypeScript, React, Node.js, Express, REST APIs, CMS, and event-driven design.
* Have solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and SASS.
* Are fluent in English and Swedish.


**Bonus points if you..**
* Have experience with Next.js, i18next, Motion/React Spring, Tailwind, Styled-components.
* Are comfortable with Django, Wagtail, or Deno.


 🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you
   

  

**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
   

  

**About**
**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
   

  

**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
   

  

**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
   

  

**Flexibility/ hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
   

  

 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
   

  

 ⚡Who are we
   

  

 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
   

  

  

  

**About Our Recruitment Process**
* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.


 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
We are looking for a
 **driven Embedded Software Engineer** 
 to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you will contribute to the development of high-quality embedded systems, working on real-time and resource-constrained applications. You’ll be part of a collaborative environment where your expertise in software design and development will help deliver innovative solutions for high-tech, automotive, or defense projects.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop embedded software for real-time and resource-constrained systems
* Work with C/C++ and Python to implement reliable software solutions
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams on design, testing, and documentation
* Contribute to system integration and verification activities



  





 We are looking for you who have:
 


* **Bachelor’s or Master’s degree** 
 in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Embedded Systems, or a related field
* Minimum
 **3 years of experience** 
 in embedded software development
* Strong programming skills in
 **C/C++**
* Experience with
 **Python**
* Professional working proficiency in
 **English**



  





 It would be a great plus if you have:
 


* Experience with
 **Java or MATLAB**
* Background in
 **Swedish high-tech electronics** 
 ,
 **defense** 
 , or
 **automotive industries**
* Knowledge of
 **functional safety** 
 , standards, or regulated environments
* Proficiency in
 **Swedish**



  





*Don’t wait to apply — we’re actively reviewing candidates as applications come in.* 




  





**What we offer you?** 




 Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We believe in growing together by offering opportunities, development and togetherness.
 



 ALTEN operates in several different industries, having a wide variety of assignments, coaching managers and training through ALTEN Academy, which means that it will always be possible to develop at ALTEN. Your wishes will guide your way forward.
 



 As a consultant, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN. Through our different internal networks, such as Women@ALTEN and ALTEN Sports you will get the opportunity to drive topics and activities that are close to your heart. At ALTEN, we think it's important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.
 



  





**About ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



 For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.
 



 Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Please note that we are
 *not* 
 currently accepting resumes or additional support from talent agencies or third-party sources. Any resumes received from these sources will be considered unsolicited.
   

  

 We value integrity and clear communication with our partners, and appreciate your understanding in this matter.
   

  

**The Role, At a Glance**
 We are seeking a Product Verification Engineer to evaluate software, firmware, associated with
   

  

 electronic devices to ensure exceptional product quality. This role involves comprehensive
   

  

 testing and validation of applications and associated audio/visual and room control equipment to
   

  

 meet rigorous quality standards.
   

  

**How You'll Contribute**
* Design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans for software, firmware, associated with electronic devices
* Perform manual and automated testing including black box testing on desktop devices, networked systems, and cloud-connected devices
* Develop and maintain automated test scripts using programming languages such as C, C++, C#, Python, or similar tools
* Configure and manage network environments for testing both locally and in cloud environments
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including development, quality assurance, and product management
* Analyze test results, identify defects, and work with development teams to resolve issues
* Document test plans, test cases, and results using tools such as Jira
* Review technical specifications and provide constructive feedback
* Support continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies
* Other duties as assigned


**A Successful Candidate Should Have**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering Technology, or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Minimum 6 years of hands-on testing experience with knowledge of diverse testing methodologies and protocols
* Demonstrated experience in product verification and validation processes
* Demonstrated experience with test automation tools
* Proficiency in programming languages: C, C++, C#, Python, or similar languages
* Experience with multiple operating systems: Windows, Linux, Android, iOS
* Strong understanding of network protocols and cloud technologies
* Experience with test management tools (Jira preferred)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to create detailed technical documentation including test plans and quality reports
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities


**Some Nice-to-haves**
* Experience with Dart and Flutter
* Experience with automation frameworks and tools such as pytest, Selenium, Test Complete, Playwright, Postman, or other API testing tools
* Knowledge of audio/visual equipment testing
* Experience with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes
* Familiarity with industry standards and compliance requirements


**Work Environment**
* Office environment with occasional lab testing
* Ability to lift to 15 kg
* On-site presence required


**Who is Biamp?**
 We make the world’s most extraordinary audio and video solutions. For over 40 years, Biamp has created and innovated professional audiovisual solutions that enable great communication. From the smallest of rooms to the largest of venues, we empower true human connection in every space.
   

  

 As we grow to meet our customers’ needs and evolve to address the challenges of tomorrow, one guiding principle remains the same: Biamp connects people through extraordinary audiovisual experiences.
   

  

**About Our Company**
 At Biamp, we believe the employment relationship should be reciprocal. We want you to love your job, and we want your expertise and knowledge to help drive our business forward. We champion a supportive and dynamic environment filled with passionate people who choose continuous improvement over perfection. We insist on clear, explicit decision making, believe in taking calculated risks, and celebrate tough decisions even when they don’t succeed. We look for people who desire the best from themselves and encourage the same from their coworkers. Our commitment to one another and to the common goal is the most consistent reliable path to recurring success for all of us.

title: SW Developer to AI Team
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*
 Your role
   

  

 In this exciting role, you will develop Software that enables AI based Signal Processing. We develop the future of Electronic Warfare (EW), and EW is extremely important in the ongoing conflicts in the world right now. Together with the Design Organization we are building an AI platform. For this we program front-end and back-end scripts to be able to quickly store data search, train and execute models and evaluate AI-based signal processing. The tasks for this position are varied, the environment is dynamic and what needs to be done is changing rapidly.
   

  

 The team works in an energetic environment that with a broad knowledge within SW Development and Data analysis. Everyone needs to learn the Electronic Warfare domain. To achieve this the team has developed excellent communication and collaboration skills. We are a team characterized with good collaborative climate that loves to solve problems together.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 To be the right fit for this position we believe that you are comfortable with a role as full stack developer creating our AI Factory. We believe you are a person with the mindset of a problem solver that will perform what it takes to reach working solutions. You should be eager to learn and have the ability to quickly absorb new information and knowledge.
   

  

 Key competencies for this position are:
   

  

* Python, JavaScript
* Kubernetes
* Docker
* Kubeflow/Airflow
* Web front-end frameworks
* S3, PostgreSQL
* Jenkins


 It is highly advantageous if you have experience from Electronic Warfare.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 The position is based in Järfälla.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: Hydrographic Surveyor, Software software engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced
 **Hydrographic Surveyor** 
 for a permanent position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



 The role focuses on inshore and nearshore hydrographic surveys in environments such as lakes, harbors, tunnels, and water dams. You will work with modern in-house survey equipment and be involved in both field operations and data processing, with a strong focus on quality and accuracy.
 



  





**Ansvar** 



* Plan and execute hydrographic surveys in inshore and nearshore environments
* Operate Multibeam Echo Sounder (MBES), Side Scan Sonar, and Sub-Bottom Profiler (SBP) systems
* Perform system calibration and patch tests
* Verify and correct sensor offsets
* Conduct RTK operations
* Carry out post-processing, data cleaning, and QA/QC
* Operate and support ROV-based survey operations
* Integrate hydrographic sensors with ROV systems and ensure correct data synchronization
* Deliver accurate, high-quality survey data and reports



**Kvalifikationer** 



* Minimum 2 years of experience as a Marine / Hydrographic Survey Engineer
* Experience in dredging and marine construction projects
* Strong knowledge of survey planning, data acquisition, and processing
* Good understanding of hydrographic survey standards and quality control
* Proven experience with ROV systems and sensor integration
* Experience with survey processing software BeamworX or similar tools

title: Client Platform Developer
description:
**About Us**
 Hacksaw Studios is a Stockholm-based game studio focused on creating innovative, high-quality gaming experiences. With a focus on performance and precision, we bring ideas to life through technical expertise and creative collaboration. We have wide distribution, and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Client Platform Developer to join our growing Stockholm team. You will play a key role in building and maintaining our client-facing platforms and tools, ensuring our games run smoothly for players, internal teams, and partners.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Include**
* Develop and Maintain: Work on core web-based products such as our in-game UI and client-communication systems.
* Integration & Collaboration: Manage client-side integrations of our games with various external platforms and support third-party studios building on our OpenRGS platform. Collaborate with back-end teams to align integration strategies with our broader platform architecture.
* Tooling & Automation: Create and maintain help-tools (e.g., scripts for changelog generation, mock clients, game launchers) to optimize workflows across different departments.
* Technical Support: Provide expertise and troubleshooting for platform-related issues, working closely with developers, QA, and customer support teams.
* UX & Visual Detail: Contribute to user-friendly interfaces and ensure a polished look and feel for our products. A good understanding of UX and a keen eye for design are preferred.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript or a similar language. (Experience with Haxe, our main client-side language, is a plus but not mandatory.)
* Strong Understanding of Web Technologies: Familiarity with browser APIs, cross-origin communication (e.g., postMessage, CORS, WebSockets), and third-party service integrations.
* Debugging & Problem-Solving Skills: Experience using browser DevTools, Postman (or similar tools), and a structured approach to identifying and resolving issues.
* Communication Skills: Ability to articulate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Service-Minded & Proactive: Comfortable owning problems, driving solutions, and collaborating with diverse teams.


**Nice-to-have**
* Experience with Git, TypeScript, React, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab, and AWS.
* Experience working with web-related C#.


 What We Offer
   

  

* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Work with experienced, passionate colleagues in the gaming industry.
* The opportunity to create games with a global audience.
* Real influence, ownership, and personal growth opportunities.
* Wellbeing perks including wellness allowance and regular in-office massage.


 Practical Details
   

  

* This is an on-site position in Stockholm.
* Unfortunately, we cannot assist with relocation or visa sponsorship.


 Ready to Join the Game Makers?
   

  

 Apply now! We review applications on a rolling basis.

title: Head of Engineering (Members Experience)
description:
Neko Health is a Swedish healthcare technology company co-founded in 2018 by Hjalmar Nilsonne and Daniel Ek. Neko's vision is to shift healthcare from reactive treatment toward preventative health and early detection. This requires completely reimagining the patient's experience and incorporating the latest advances in sensors and AI. Neko Health has developed a new medical scanning technology concept to make it possible to do broad and non-invasive health data collection that is convenient and affordable for the public. The company is based in Stockholm, offering the Neko Body Scan experience at locations in Stockholm, London and Manchester, with over 500 employees.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Own the frontend technical vision and architecture across web, mobile, and immersive platforms
* Set and enforce engineering standards for quality, performance, accessibility, and reliability
* Lead critical technical decisions and guide long-term evolution of the frontend stack
* Partner with Product, Design, Backend, and Hardware to deliver complex, user-facing features
* Mentor senior engineers and shape frontend culture, hiring, and progression
* Ensure frontend systems scale with product growth and organizational complexity


**Requirements**
* Proven experience leading and scaling teams building large-scale user-facing products
* Strong full-stack background with deep expertise in modern frontend architectures
* Strong experience either hands-on or leading multiple teams across web, mobile (native or cross-platform), and complex UI systems
* Track record of metrics-driven development (UX, engagement, performance, reliability)
* Experience owning deployment, release, and lifecycle of frontend systems tied to backend services
* Ability to influence technical direction and align stakeholders at senior levels


**About The Engineering Team**
**Distributed and Remote First**
 We are nearly 100 full time engineers at the company, working from Berlin, Chamonix, Hamburg, Lisbon, Marseille, Vilnius, and Stockholm, spanning diverse disciplines such as Hardware Engineering, Firmware Development, Electrical Design, Algorithm Development, Machine Learning Development, Optronics Research, Frontend Development and more. We don't expect people to join us with a specific tech knowledge, but we do expect you to work with our tools. We use a mix of React, Typescript, C++, and Python. Our APIs are written in C# with ASP.NET Core, uses Azure Cosmos DB, and Azure Active Directory for authentication.
   

  

 Our headquarters and our hardware development team are in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 We are a Remote First company; however, it is of course much easier to work remotely as a software engineer than a hardware or firmware engineer (since they require access to hardware or devices occasionally). Software engineers based in Stockholm work maybe one day a week or one day every two weeks from the office.
   

  

 We meet a couple of times per year to get to know each other and have fun.
   

  

**Organization and Way of Working**
 The engineering team is divided into smaller cross functional project teams that each focus on a specific goal or target, where some groups are long-lived, and some are short-lived, depending on how big the goal or deliverable is. We strive to create groups which are cross-functional and able to complete their goals without dependence on other teams, even though this is of course not always possible.
   

  

 Groups track goals on a yearly and quarterly basis with goal follow-up across the entire engineering organization on a bi-weekly basis. Most groups do internal planning on a bi-weekly basis, but in the end it's up to the group to decide how they want to work.
   

  

 We have, however, mandated that all groups must present their progress or failures or hacks at our bi-weekly engineering demo, a fun meeting/presentation where we talk about everything from short-circuiting power-modules, how hard it is to calibrate cameras or align polygons in space, to neat new command line tools for operations, a new auth mechanism in the backend, a cool new way to visualize health data or a new feature which helps our doctors be more productive.
   

  

 We have a flexible workplace that focuses on work/life balance, and we strongly believe in our mission but do not think that achieving it requires sacrificing everything else.
   

  

 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Javautvecklare
description:
Om java är din kopp te så kan konsultrollen på HiQ vara nästa steg i karriären! Just nu söker vi erfarna Java-utvecklare som vill axla konsultrollen och vara med på vår fortsatta tillväxtresa.
   

  

 I rollen får du jobba med avancerad teknik i varierande kundprojekt i olika branscher som exempelvis finans, industri eller offentlig sektor. Du blir en viktig del i teamet där du bidrar med din tekniska kompetens, ditt engagemang och din vilja att utvecklas.
   

  

 Just nu är vi i uppstarten av flera spännande nyutvecklingsprojekt där bli bland annat utvecklar samhällskritisk infrastruktur och formar framtidens energilösningar.
   

  

 Som en av oss på HiQ får du inte bara möjlighet att jobba med kompetenta kollegor och utvecklande uppdrag, du får även ett kontor med stark teamanda, fantastisk utsikt över Slussen och en roll där du får diskutera och lösa komplexa situationer tillsammans med dina kollegor.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Ingenjörsexamen i datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Javautveckling
* Svenskt medborgarskap samt flytande i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, testautomation och agila metoder
* Erfarenhet av Kafka, Kubernetes, Spring Boot, Angular eller React
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microservicearkitektur


*Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och letar efter dig som är flexibel och kommunikativ som trivs i en miljö där förändringar är en del av vardagen. Du värdesätter också ett gott samarbete i teamet och delar gärna med dig av dina tidigare erfarenheter till dina kollegor.*
**Varför HiQ**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ varit konsultbolaget som förenklat världen för både kunder och slutanvändare med hjälp av teknik, design och kommunikation. HiQ har alltid fokuserat på två saker: att ha kul på jobbet och att leverera lösningar utöver förväntningar - det är vad som driver oss framåt! Vi HiQare är stolta över att ha en kultur som präglas av
 **resultat** 
 ,
 **ansvar, enkelhet** 
 och
 **glädje** 
 . Vi tror på att arbeta tillsammans för att nå våra gemensamma mål och strävar efter att hjälpa varandra att fortsätta växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du utöver chansen att utveckla din egen kompetens också möjlighet att lära, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering tillämpar vi löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

title: Engineering Manager - Financial Systems
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 As our Engineering Manager - Financial Systems, you'll be the creative force behind our financial infrastructure, leading a team of 5-10 application specialists and developers. Your work will have a tangible impact, ensuring our financial operations are as innovative and efficient as the content we power. You'll partner directly with Finance and IT leaders, shaping the technical direction and fostering a team culture where everyone feels heard and amplified.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Leading our Financial Systems team to ensure our financial operations are efficient and accurate.
* Pioneering the technical strategy for our financial systems to support Epidemic Sound's rapid growth.
* Overseeing the implementation, maintenance, and optimization of our financial software.
* Ensuring data integrity and compliance with financial regulations.
* Inspiring and empowering your team, living out our values and leadership principles.
* Evaluating, selecting, and managing relationships with financial software vendors.


**Requirements**
 To succeed in this impactful role, we believe you should have:
   

  

* 2+ years of experience leading and nurturing high-performing teams of financial systems experts.
* Proven ownership of a company's financial systems technical strategy.
* A knack for communicating complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* A history of identifying and implementing process automation and optimization.
* Strong collaboration skills, with a track record of partnering effectively with stakeholders.
* A history of fostering an inclusive and psychologically safe environment within your team
* NetSuite / ERP systems and their integration with Salesforce.


 It would also be music to our ears if you have experience with:
   

  

* Invoice-to-pay software (e.g., Medius), Spend management software (e.g., Expensify), Consolidation software (e.g., Aaro), and Planning and Budgeting software (e.g., NSPB).
* Working in an agile environment.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
   

  

 Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound. In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Rikard Herlitz, Chief Tech Officer where he shares what makes developers most happy, what velocity means to him and how Epidemic Sound is in the sweet spot when it comes to AI.Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: DevOps ingenjör
description:
**Redpill Linpro är ledande open source leverantör och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle - helt enkelt för vi tror att öppenheten skapar ett säkert och hållbart samhälle.**
**Vårt DevOps-team i Stockholm består av runt 20 erfarna specialister. Vi arbetar med bland annat Kubernetes, OpenShift, Red Hat och andra open source-teknologier i konsultprojekt som gör faktisk nytta för samhället.**
**Nu vill vi bli fler och söker dig som är erfaren inom DevOps eller plattform och vill fortsätta utvecklas tillsammans med andra som tar tekniken på allvar.**
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi söker erfarna DevOps-utvecklare som vill stötta upp våra team och arbeta i en av Nordens tyngsta Linux-miljöer. Tillsammans med riktig vassa kollegor kommer du ta del av spännande kundprojekt och utveckla framtidens lösningar. För dig som har erfarenhet av, eller ett intresse för att utvecklas in i en ledande roll och driva team framåt så erbjuds även denna möjlighet
   

  

**Du kommer exempelvis arbeta med:**
* Systemdrift, arkitektur och code review
* Automatisera arbetsflöden med CI/CD i Git och Jenkins
* Containerteknologer såsom Docker, Kubernetes och OpenShift
* Molnbaserade lösningar såsom AWS, Azure eller OpenStack
* Scriptspråk så som shell script, Ruby och Python
* PostgreSQL/MySQL, Nginx, Varnish och Apache
* Konfigurering i Puppet och Ansible


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss har du ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relaterat område
* Flera års erfarenhet av DevOps-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av en eller flera av ovanstående teknologier
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**
* Vi ser gärna att du har en bred Linux-grund och har labbat runt med flera distributörer
* Erfarenhet av automatisering och/eller Cloud
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och GitOps


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Önskar du att bli en del av vårt team? Tveka inte att höra av dig. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Head of Enterprise IT
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a visionary Enterprise IT Manager to lead the strategic evolution of the department. You will maintain our high standards of daily operations by managing enterprise IT systems, devices, and support services for our engineering and business teams. You will also actively pivot the organisation to focus on Engineering Enablement to create great conditions for our developers to build and ship software without friction.
   

  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**
 Global Team Leadership
   

  

* Lead, mentor, and evolve a distributed team of 35 IT professionals across eight countries and multiple time zones.
* Manage six direct reports, fostering a culture of autonomy, customer service, and technical curiosity.
* Travel occasionally to our key hubs to build relationships and align operations.


 Engineering-First Strategy
   

  

* Partner with Engineering VPs and Leads to understand their pain points.
* Tilt the IT roadmap to prioritise developer efficiency—whether that means high-performance compute hardware, optimised network low-latency routes for testing, or efficient VPN solutions to make it easy to test our applications.


 Operational Excellence at Scale
   

  

* Oversee the lifecycle management of hardware, software, and mobile devices for the entire 2,000-person workforce.
* Manage corporate networks and security protocols, balancing security requirements with the flexibility engineers need to work effectively.
* Ensure our Global Service Desk provides "white glove" support to everyone from the C-suite to the Junior Dev.
* Level up the IT supplier landscape, leveraging on opportunities to consolidate and evolving IT supplier management.


**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**
**Essential Skills**
* You have previous success in a comparable Enterprise IT management position within a modern tech environment.
* You have experience managing managers. You know how to run a 30+ person organisation across multiple countries and time zones (EU/UK/US), focusing on strategy and unblocking your team. You know how to build culture remotely.
* You communicate proactively and strategically with Engineering VPs and business leaders to ensure IT is recognised as a strategic enabler. You focus on transparency and clarity to build trust and alignment across the wider organisation.
* You have a strong background working within or alongside software development organisations. You understand the SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) and how IT decisions impact compile times, build speeds, and developer happiness. You understand what a compile time is and why local admin rights matter.
* You possess an excellent ability to communicate with both technical Engineering VPs and non-technical business leaders (Finance/HR).
* You have experience negotiating contracts with global hardware/software vendors and managing the logistics of hardware distribution to challenging locations.
* You have knowledge of enterprise networking, specifically tuned for a distributed workforce.
* You are versatile - you can present a budget to the CFO in the morning and dive into a complex distribution logic problem with your team in the afternoon.


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Engineering background: as a SysAdmin, a DevOps engineer, or a Developer.
* A strong preference for automating onboarding, offboarding, and provisioning processes. You prefer code/scripts over manual tickets.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


**JOIN US!**
 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
